The user who performs the installation must be a member of the SysAdmin server role on the database server.
SOLUTION: Use another user to perform the installation, or ask your database administrator to add your user to the SysAdmin server role.

User tables belonging to the dbo schema were found in the database .
SOLUTION: You can only install an SAP system in a database with no user objects belonging to the system schema dbo.

Database has the wrong compatibility level.
The compatibility level of the database used for the installation of a SAP system must be set to the default compatibility level of the underlying SQL Server release (e.g. 90 for MS SQL Server 2005, 100 for MS SQL Server 2008/SQL Server 2008 R2, ...).
SOLUTION: See the MS SQL Server documentation on how to set the compatibility level for your database to the default.

area.name: controller
SEC-274
area.message: SAP strongly recommends you to ONLY use software packages that are officially signed by SAP. The digital signature ensures that the signatory of a digital document can be identified unambiguously and that the signatory's name is documented together with the signed document, the date, and the time. With the specified start parameters for this run you accept these software packages, even if they are NOT officially signed by SAP. A man-in-the-middle attack might use this recognized security breach.

Warning

The installation is using a logical host name that is different from the physical host name. In this case the check for duplicate instance numbers only considers instances running on logical host . Instances running on the physical host or instances running on other logical hosts configured for this physical host will not be considered.

Check carefully that the instance numbers suggested by the installation program are not in use on any logical host name used for the physical host .

  • Start and stop the Java EE Engine
  • Develop, deploy, and run Web Services and Java applications.

You can also try out the online SAP NetWeaver Tutorials, which include the most recent Getting Started guides, code examples, and technical notes relating to this version. Try out the online SAP Web Application Server tutorials, which include the most recent Getting Started guides, code examples, and technical notes relating to this version. These documents are available on the SAP Developer Network (http://sdn.sap.com): Go to the Web Application Server Developer Area and choose Code Samples and Tutorials.

area.name: declustering
area.message: The SAP kernel does not support declustering the system. The database load is performed without declustering.

The export was declustered, but the SAP kernel does not support declustering for the import. The target system installation might have been started using an incorrect product or release in Software Provisioning Manager.

There are properties missing in
. This can happen when exporting the system using Software Provisioning Manager for NW 7.0x-based systems (70SWPM*.SAR) and starting the target system installation using Software Provisioning Manager for NW 7.1x and higher-based systems (SWPM*.SAR). SOLUTION: Either select a target system installation option using Software Provisioning Manager 7.0x or re-execute the export using Software Provisioning Manager for NW 7.1x and higher-based systems.

Declustering using sockets must be performed on the import side. Select OK to set declustering to 'false'.
If the target system should be declustered, you must first export the environment variable SUPPORT_DECLUSTERING=true before you start the import. For more information, see SAP Note 1738258.

When declustering and splitting tables using the Oracle specific splitter, make sure that you only split transparent tables. Otherwise use the database independent 'R3ta' table splitter. For more information, see SAP Note 1043380.
Cannot retrieve SAP basis version. To enable declustering during the export, start 'sapinst' with property 'SUPPORT_DECLUSTERING=true'.

You can improve export performance by using the following formula:
Number of Parallel Export Jobs = 3 * (number of CPU cores).
However, such a setting might negatively impact other applications running at the same time on the same host.
To avoid impact, reduce the number of r3load jobs, for example by using the default value.

You can improve import performance using the following formula:
Number of Parallel Export Jobs = 3 * (number of CPU cores).
However, such a setting might negatively impact other applications running at the same time on the same host.
To avoid impact, reduce the number of r3load jobs, for example by using the default value.

Cannot get the ID of AS Java instance ( )
SOLUTION: Start the GUI Config Tool and determine the instance ID. Set the profile parameter j2ee/instance_id in the instance profile and choose Ok.
Choose Cancel to skip deleting the instance in the database. You can then delete the instance manually using the GUI Config Tool.

Cannot remove the AS Java instance for instance ( ) in the database. For details see the output of log file .

SOLUTION:

  1. Make sure that the database is up and running.
  2. Start the GUI Config Tool, choose Secure Store -> Connection Pools , and make sure that the credentials (user, password) are correct. Check if the instance ID is correct and the instance exists in the database.
  3. Choose Ok to retry deleting the instance.
  4. Choose Cancel to skip deleting the instance in the database.
    If you skip deleting the instance in the database, delete the instance manually using the GUI Config Tool.

SOLUTION: Edit the profile of the instance as specified below and restart the instance.

Include the following lines in the profile:

rdisp/msserv = 0
rdisp/msserv_internal = XXXX

where XXXX denotes a free port number on your host.

For more information see SAP Note 821875.

The message server in instance / on host is not configured to open a HTTP port.

SOLUTION: Edit the profile of the instance as specified below and restart the instance.

Include a line equivalent to the following in the profile:

ms/server_port_0 = PROT=HTTP,PORT=XXXX

where XXXX denotes a free port number on your machine.

rdisp/msserv = 0
rdisp/msserv_internal = XXXX

area.name: framework
area.message: Stop Instance Services for Update...
Extract Installation Package for SAP Instance Framework...
Update Instance Services...
Start Instance Services after Update...

The instance was running before its instance service was stopped, but now after the instance service was restarted the instane itself appears to be stopped.

When the service of a running instance is stopped all processes that belong to that instance continue to run in the background. The instance service should generally be able to catch all these processes after it was started again and report the instance status as running.

Please check the running processes of your system in order to make sure that none of the processes of the instance are still running in the background. If this is the case you have to stop these processes manually. Afterwards you can restart the instance.

Following processes were running as part of the instance before the service was stopped:

An error occured while updating the instance service of instance .

The update is done via sapcpe which redistributes the installation framework files from the central executable folder on the global host of the MDM system into the executable folder of the instance.

The sapcpe process for instance finished with return code which indicates that an error occured. Please check the installation log files at



and contact SAP support.

Press 'OK' if you want to continue with the remaining steps of the update.
Press 'Cancel' in order to stop the update at this point.

Some inconsistencies has been found during the inbox validation.
These are listed in "CEScanInboxResult.html" from the working directory.
SOLUTION:
Follow the instructions given in "Required Action" column of "INBOX consistency check report". Once listed inconsistencies are fixed or acceptable then:

Choose OK to repeat the validation (on success the update procedure will continue).

Choose Cancel to skip the validation and continue the update procedure.

Problem



SOLUTION:

For more information about how to solve the problem, refer to SAP Note 1463464 and the solution provided below.

Most probably an update that previously failed was not continued and a new update process was started.
The current work directory, which contains all files and folders created by the CE Update Manager during the update process is located in \Program Files\sapinst_instdir\SMP_UPDATE\updateManagerService on Windows or /tmp/sapinst_instdir/SMP_UPDATE/updateManagerService on Unix.
The log directory, which contains all files and folders created by the CE Update Manager during a previous update process is located in the work directory with a name "log_<date>_<time>".

After stopping the current update process, you have to continue the previous update process and perform the following steps:
  1. Delete (or backup) all files and folders in the work directory except the log directories.
  2. Copy the content from the corresponding log directory (including the sub-directories) to the current work directory.
  3. Start the CE Update Manager again and choose "Continue with the old option" when asked

SAP Web Application Server 6.20 for Oracle

Software Provisioning Manager now stops the installation.

To proceed with the installation, execute the script on the database.

After you have executed the script on the database host, proceed with the instance installation by choosing 'OK' in this dialog box.

Software Provisioning Manager now stops the installation.

To proceed with the installation, install the Oracle database as follows:

  1. Log in as user ora .
  2. Set the DISPLAY variable.
  3. Change to directory /database/Disk1/SAP.
  4. Start './RUNINSTALLER'.
After installing the Oracle database software, check for additional Oracle patches in the relevant SAP Note:
  • SAP Note 2660017 (for Oracle 18c and Oracle 19c)
  • SAP Note 1915313 (for Oracle 12c)
  • SAP Note 1431799 (for Oracle 11.2)
  • SAP Note 871096 (for Oracle 10.2)
Then continue with the database instance installation by choosing 'OK' in this dialog box.

Reboot Required

Software Provisioning Manager needs to reboot the machine in order to reliably continue processing.

Choose OK to reboot the machine now and continue processing when you log on again.
Choose Cancel to reboot the machine manually and restart the Software Provisioning Manager afterwards.

Log Off Required

Software Provisioning Manager needs to log you off in order to reliably continue the installation.

If you choose OK, Software Provisioning Manager will log you off and continue the installation when you log on again.
You can also choose Cancel now, log off yourself and restart Software Provisioning Manager afterwards.

Note:
If this message reappears after the new logon, your domain is probably setting group policies. In this case, make sure the account which runs the installation has the following User rights before continuing:
Act as part of the operating system, Increase quotas and Replace a process level token.

Soft resource limit file descriptors (one more than the maximum value that the system may assign to a newly created descriptor) must have value 2048. Current value is:
.
Hard Resource Limit file descriptors

.
Soft Resource Limit CPU Time

Soft resource limit cpu time (maximum amount of CPU time in seconds) must be unlimited. Current value is:
.
Soft Resource Limit File Size

Soft resource limit file size (maximum size of a file in bytes that may be created by a process) must be unlimited. Current value is:
.
Soft Resource Limit Data Size

Soft resource limit data size (maximum size of a process's heap in bytes) must have a value greater than or equal to 2147479552. Current value is:
.
Soft Resource Limit Stack Size

Soft resource limit stack size (maximum size of a process's stack in bytes) must have a value greater than or equal to 8388608. Current value is:
.
Soft Resource Limit Core Dump Size

Soft resource limit core dump size (maximum size of a core file in bytes) must be unlimited. Current value is:
.
Soft Resource Limit Virtual Memory Size

Soft resource limit virtual memory size (maximum size of a process's mapped address space in bytes) must be unlimited. Current value is:
.

area.name: os_rlimit
area.message: Resource Controls

On Solaris 10, several kernel parameters related to inter-process communication (IPC) have been replaced with resource controls. However, this version of the installation prerequisite checker is not able to check resource controls. Make sure to check them manually. See also SAP Note 724713 and http://docs.sun.com -> Solaris 10 System Administrator Collection -> Solaris Tunable Parameters Reference Manual -> 1. Overview of Solaris System Tuning -> What's New in Solaris System Tuning.

RLIMIT_AS: maximum size of a process' total available memory, in bytes
